text:
Raskolnikov stood in the dirty tavern. 

“I was going to see you,” he said. 

Svidrigaïlov laughed. “Why not call it a miracle?” 

“It may be only chance,” Raskolnikov replied. 

“Cowards have no opinions,” Svidrigaïlov teased. 

Raskolnikov frowned. “I have my own opinion.” 

“Ah, that’s why you intrigued me,” Svidrigaïlov said, sipping wine. 

“Nothing else?” 

“Enough for now,” Svidrigaïlov smiled, eyes glinting.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov unexpectedly encounters Svidrigaïlov at a dismal tavern, leading to a discussion about chance and belief in miracles.
